for as long as i can remember, i had to deal with social and family bullshit. even when i was younger, my class made fun of me and bullied me. my parents would fight and my sisters would fight with each other or my dad. a lot. 

i thought crying in my room constantly was okay.

i thought that everyone had this kind of thing happen, so i never thought twice about it. 

when i was five, i actually noticed i was getting bullied. i was being teased and made fun of, and generally being outcast from my own damn class. i never felt truly welcome.

my blanket of video game grew over time. as the bullying got worse, to a point where i actually had to fight someone, and the home life was still unbearably stressful, i used a 3ds, wii, and ps2 to drown it out. this, paired with that one insanely good friend, kept me happy.

third grade was more of the same. bullying at school, being degraded into dirt, and coming home to stress. i still thought at this point that hiding and crying because of my home life was a normal thing. and it would happen often.

fifth grade was a new layer of hell. i was forced into an after school activity i hated. the bullying intensified further and started to go past just verbal abuse. home life was very bad. and i was starting to notice it more and more. 

without that friend, i lost some cover.

i’m the product of bullying, abuse, and being outcast. i’m the product of too much stress and pressure, but never an outlet. i’m constantly bouncing around thoughts of suicide and serious self harm. i don’t have a thick enough blanket of friends or distractions to help me.
